21/*! \file bmconst.h
22 \brief Constants, lookup tables and typedefs
23 @internal
24*/
25
26#include <cstdint>
27#include <inttypes.h>
28
29namespace bm
30{
31
32#if defined(_WIN32) || defined (_WIN64)
33typedef unsigned __int64 id64_t;
34#else
35typedef unsigned long long int id64_t;
36#endif
37
38typedef unsigned int id_t;
39typedef unsigned int word_t;
40typedef unsigned short short_t;
41
42#ifndef BM_DEFAULT_POOL_SIZE
43# define BM_DEFAULT_POOL_SIZE 4096
44#endif
45
46#ifdef BM64ADDR
47const unsigned long long id_max32 = 0xFFFFFFFFull;
48const unsigned long long id_max48 = 0xFFFFFFFFFFFFull;
49#else
50const unsigned id_max32 = 0xFFFFFFFFu;
51#endif
52
53// Data Block parameters
54
55const unsigned set_block_size = 2048u;
56const unsigned set_block_shift = 16u;
57const unsigned set_block_mask = 0xFFFFu;
58const unsigned set_blkblk_mask = 0xFFFFFFu;
59
60// set block size in bytes
61const unsigned set_block_alloc_size = bm::set_block_size * unsigned(sizeof(bm::word_t));
62
63const unsigned set_block_plane_size = bm::set_block_size / 32u;
64const unsigned set_block_plane_cnt = (unsigned)(sizeof(bm::word_t) * 8u);
65
66const unsigned block_waves = 64;
67const unsigned set_block_digest_wave_size = bm::set_block_size / bm::block_waves;
68const unsigned set_block_digest_pos_shift = 10;
69
70// Word parameters
71
72const unsigned set_word_shift = 5u;
73const unsigned set_word_mask = 0x1Fu;
74
75
76// GAP related parameters.
77
78typedef unsigned short gap_word_t;
79
80const unsigned gap_max_buff_len = 1280;
81const unsigned gap_max_bits = 65536;
82const unsigned gap_equiv_len = (unsigned)
83 ((sizeof(bm::word_t) * bm::set_block_size) / sizeof(bm::gap_word_t));
84const unsigned gap_max_bits_cmrz = bm::gap_max_bits / 2;
85const unsigned gap_levels = 4;
86const unsigned gap_max_level = bm::gap_levels - 1;
87
88const unsigned bie_cut_off = 16384; // binary interpolative encode size cut-off
89
90
91// Block Array parameters
92
93
94const unsigned set_array_size32 = 256u;
95const unsigned set_sub_array_size = set_array_size32;
96const unsigned set_array_shift = 8u;
97const unsigned set_array_mask = 0xFFu;
98
99const unsigned set_total_blocks32 = (bm::set_array_size32 * bm::set_array_size32);
100const unsigned set_sub_total_bits = bm::set_sub_array_size * bm::gap_max_bits;
101
102#ifdef BM64ADDR
103const unsigned set_total_blocks48 = bm::id_max48 / bm::gap_max_bits;
104const unsigned long long id_max = bm::id_max48;
105const unsigned long long set_array_size48 = 1 + (bm::id_max48 / set_sub_total_bits);
106const unsigned set_top_array_size = bm::set_array_size48;
107const id64_t set_total_blocks = id64_t(bm::set_top_array_size) * set_sub_array_size;
108#else
109const unsigned id_max = bm::id_max32;
110const unsigned set_top_array_size = bm::set_array_size32;
111const unsigned set_total_blocks = bm::set_total_blocks32;
112#endif
113
114const unsigned bits_in_block = bm::set_block_size * unsigned((sizeof(bm::word_t) * 8));
115const unsigned bits_in_array = bm::bits_in_block * bm::set_array_size32;
116
117
118// Rank-Select parameters (linear address to split the searches
119const unsigned rs3_border0 = 21824; // 682 words by 32-bits
120const unsigned rs3_border1 = (rs3_border0 * 2); // 43648
121const unsigned rs3_half_span = rs3_border0 / 2;
122const unsigned rs3_border0_1 = rs3_border0 + rs3_half_span; // intermed pnt 1
123const unsigned rs3_border1_1 = rs3_border1 + rs3_half_span; // intermed pnt 2
124
125// misc parameters for sparse vec algorithms
126const unsigned sub_block3_size = bm::gap_max_bits / 4;
127
128
129#if defined(BM64OPT) || defined(BM64_SSE4)
130typedef id64_t wordop_t;
131const id64_t all_bits_mask = 0xffffffffffffffffULL;
132const unsigned set_block_size_op = bm::set_block_size / 2;
133#else
134typedef word_t wordop_t;
135const word_t all_bits_mask = 0xffffffff;
136const unsigned set_block_size_op = bm::set_block_size;
137#endif
138
139
140/*!
141 @brief Block allocation strategies.
142 @ingroup bvector
143*/
144enum strategy
145{
146 BM_BIT = 0, //!< No GAP compression strategy. All new blocks are bit blocks.
147 BM_GAP = 1 //!< GAP compression is ON.
148};
149
150/*!
151 @brief copy strategy
152 @ingroup bvector
153*/
154enum finalization
155{
156 BM_UNDEFINED = 0,
157 BM_READONLY = 1, //!< immutable (read-only object)
158 BM_READWRITE = 2, //!< mutable (read-write object)
159};
160
161
162/**
163 Codes of set operations
164 @ingroup bvector
165*/
166enum set_operation
167{
168 set_AND = 0,
169 set_OR = 1,
170 set_SUB = 2,
171 set_XOR = 3,
172 set_ASSIGN = 4,
173 set_COUNT = 5,
174 set_COUNT_AND = 6,
175 set_COUNT_XOR = 7,
176 set_COUNT_OR = 8,
177 set_COUNT_SUB_AB= 9,
178 set_COUNT_SUB_BA= 10,
179 set_COUNT_A = 11,
180 set_COUNT_B = 12,
181
182 set_END
183};
184
185/**
186 Bit operations
187 @ingroup bvector
188*/
189enum operation
190{
191 BM_AND = set_AND,
192 BM_OR = set_OR,
193 BM_SUB = set_SUB,
194 BM_XOR = set_XOR
195};
196
197
198/*!
199 @brief Sort order declaration
200 @ingroup bvector
201*/
202enum sort_order
203{
204 BM_UNSORTED = 0, //!< input set is NOT sorted
205 BM_SORTED = 1, //!< input set is sorted (ascending order)
206 BM_SORTED_UNIFORM = 2, //!< sorted and in one block (internal!)
207 BM_UNKNOWN = 3 //!< sort order unknown
208};
209
210
211/*!
212 @brief set representation variants
213 @internal
214*/
215enum set_representation
216{
217 set_bitset = 0, //!< Simple bitset
218 set_gap = 1, //!< GAP-RLE compression
219 set_array1 = 2, //!< array of set 1 values
220 set_array0 = 3 //!< array of 0 values
221};
222
223/*!
224 @brief NULL-able value support
225 @ingroup bvector
226*/
227enum null_support
228{
229 use_null = 0, //!< support "non-assigned" or "NULL" logic
230 no_null = 1 //!< do not support NULL values
231};
232
233
234/**
235 Internal structure. Copyright information.
236 @internal
237*/
238template<bool T> struct _copyright
239{
240 static const char _p[]; ///< Version as a text
241 static const unsigned _v[3]; ///< MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH version components
242};
243
244template<bool T> const char _copyright<T>::_p[] =
245 "BitMagic C++ Library. v.7.10.3 (c) 2002-2022 Anatoliy Kuznetsov.";
246template<bool T> const unsigned _copyright<T>::_v[3] = {7, 10, 3};
247

250/**
251 DeBruijn majic table
252 @internal
253*/
254template<bool T> struct DeBruijn_bit_position
255{
256 static const unsigned _multiply[32];
257};
258
259template<bool T>
260const unsigned DeBruijn_bit_position<T>::_multiply[32] = {

262 31, 27, 13, 23, 21, 19, 16, 7, 26, 12, 18, 6, 11, 5, 10, 9
263};

266 Structure keeps index of first right 1 bit for every byte.

353/** Structure keeps all-left/right ON bits masks.
354 @ingroup bitfunc
355*/
356template<bool T> struct block_set_table
357{
358 static const unsigned _left[32];
359 static const unsigned _right[32];
360};
361
362template<bool T>
363const unsigned block_set_table<T>::_left[32] = {
364 0x1, 0x3, 0x7, 0xf, 0x1f, 0x3f, 0x7f, 0xff, 0x1ff, 0x3ff, 0x7ff,
365 0xfff, 0x1fff, 0x3fff, 0x7fff, 0xffff, 0x1ffff, 0x3ffff, 0x7ffff,
366 0xfffff, 0x1fffff, 0x3fffff, 0x7fffff, 0xffffff, 0x1ffffff, 0x3ffffff,
367 0x7ffffff, 0xfffffff, 0x1fffffff, 0x3fffffff, 0x7fffffff, 0xffffffff
368};
369
370template<bool T>
371const unsigned block_set_table<T>::_right[32] = {
372 0xffffffff, 0xfffffffe, 0xfffffffc, 0xfffffff8, 0xfffffff0,
373 0xffffffe0, 0xffffffc0, 0xffffff80, 0xffffff00, 0xfffffe00,
374 0xfffffc00, 0xfffff800, 0xfffff000, 0xffffe000, 0xffffc000,
375 0xffff8000, 0xffff0000, 0xfffe0000, 0xfffc0000, 0xfff80000,
376 0xfff00000, 0xffe00000, 0xffc00000, 0xff800000, 0xff000000,
377 0xfe000000, 0xfc000000, 0xf8000000, 0xf0000000, 0xe0000000,
378 0xc0000000, 0x80000000

385/*! @brief Default GAP lengths table.
386 @ingroup gapfunc
387*/
388template<bool T> struct gap_len_table
389{
390 static const gap_word_t _len[bm::gap_levels];
391};
392
393template<bool T>
394const gap_word_t gap_len_table<T>::_len[bm::gap_levels] =
395 { 128, 256, 512, bm::gap_max_buff_len };
396
397
398/*! @brief Alternative GAP lengths table.
399 Good for for memory saver mode and very sparse bitsets.
400
401 @ingroup gapfunc
402*/
403template<bool T> struct gap_len_table_min
404{
405 static const gap_word_t _len[bm::gap_levels];
406};
407
408template<bool T>
409const gap_word_t gap_len_table_min<T>::_len[bm::gap_levels] =
410 { 32, 96, 128, 512 };
411
412
413/*! @brief Non-linear size growth GAP lengths table.
414 @ingroup gapfunc
415*/
416template<bool T> struct gap_len_table_nl
417{
418 static const gap_word_t _len[bm::gap_levels];
419};
420
421template<bool T>
422const gap_word_t gap_len_table_nl<T>::_len[bm::gap_levels] =
423 { 32, 128, 512, bm::gap_max_buff_len };
424
425/*!
426 @brief codes for supported SIMD optimizations
427*/
428enum simd_codes
429{
430 simd_none = 0, ///!< No SIMD or any other optimization
431 simd_sse2 = 1, ///!< Intel SSE2
432 simd_sse42 = 2, ///!< Intel SSE4.2
433 simd_avx2 = 5, ///!< Intel AVX2
434 simd_avx512 = 6, ///!< Intel AVX512
435 simd_wasm128 = 7, ///! WASM SIMD 128
436 simd_neon = 8 ///!< ARM Neon
437};
438
439
440/*!
441 \brief Byte orders recognized by the library.
442 @internal
443*/
444enum ByteOrder
445{
446 BigEndian = 0,
447 LittleEndian = 1
448};
449
450/**
451 Internal structure. Different global settings.
452 @internal
453*/
454template<bool T> struct globals
455{
456 struct bo
457 {
458 ByteOrder _byte_order;
459
460 bo()
461 {
462 unsigned x;
463 unsigned char *s = (unsigned char *)&x;
464 s[0] = 1; s[1] = 2; s[2] = 3; s[3] = 4;
465 if(x == 0x04030201)
466 {
467 _byte_order = LittleEndian;
468 return;
469 }
470 if(x == 0x01020304)
471 {
472 _byte_order = BigEndian;
473 return;
474 }
475 _byte_order = LittleEndian;
476 }
477 };
478
479 static bo _bo;
480 static ByteOrder byte_order() { return _bo._byte_order; }
481};
482template<bool T> typename globals<T>::bo globals<T>::_bo;
483
484

486} // namespace
